"The game starts with a score of 1. Then the player decides several times in a row in which direction to move on a grid, containing operations that will apply to the score (in the order in which they were crossed). The player can swipe in a direction to make a move in that direction"

"The goal is to get the highest score possible. Each level has a maximum score, which can be reached but not exceeded. This score is displayed for each level. The grid does not have to be fully exploited to finish the level. The game ends when the player has reached the maximum score."

"The game currently contains 3 levels of difficulty depending on the size of the grid; the larger the grid, the higher the difficulty. The levels get more and more difficult. Each difficulty level contains 50 levels. Initially, only the first level of the first difficulty level is available. After that, the player must complete levels in order to unlock new ones."

"The player can erase the last move, by going in the opposite direction of it. At any time, the player can decide to restart the game, by pressing the restart button. The solution of the level can be displayed, after viewing an advertisement, by clicking on the video icon. If several solutions exist, only one example of a solution is displayed."
